page.title: 19Bayford/L'B'std _ Houses
page.content: In both villages the houses are concentrated on one main road, and although there is a mixture of styles, the main materials used have been{red {brick and tiles,}old or new.Slate roofs are uncommon.There is a good deal of relatively modern built housing,built in traditional style. Of particular interest in L'B'sted is a row of clap-board and brick built cottages,with tiled roofs,{over 300 {years old.}We were shown the low oak beams inside, and told that remains of earlier thatching had been found. In Bayford, next to the pub, can be seen a{late 16C pair of cottages,}one in need of renovation. The low door ways and the tall 17C chimney are distinctive.Near the church are six, originally thatched and one storey, cottages, over 200 years old.
